revised_title: Phytogeographical Relationships of Angiosperm Flora in the British Solomon Islands Protectorate
tldr: The author analyzes the angiosperm flora of the British Solomon Islands Protectorate, finding that it primarily consists of genera also found in New Guinea. The flora has around 1650 native species and a low degree of endemism, making it distinct from the "Three Ns" regions of New Guinea, New Caledonia, and New Zealand.
